instance_template:
loc("HubWest"; "NodeA"; "NodeB"; "Sensor1"; "Sensor2").
edge("HubWest", "NodeA").
edge("HubWest", "NodeB").
edge("NodeA", "Sensor1").
edge("NodeB", "Sensor2").
edge("NodeA", "NodeB").
time(0..9).
at("HubWest", 0).
inspect("Sensor1"; "Sensor2").
generator:
1 { at(L, T) : loc(L) } 1 :- time(T).
1 { inspect_at(L, T) : time(T) } 1 :- inspect(L).

hard_constraints.description: Listen carefully, class: the drone cannot teleport! For the drone to move between two different locations in consecutive minutes, there must be a defined edge connecting them in our map.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- at(L1, T), at(L2, T+1), not edge(L1, L2), not edge(L2, L1), L1 != L2.

hard_constraints.description: It is important to remember that you cannot inspect a sensor if you aren't actually there. We must ensure the drone's location matches the sensor's location at the time of inspection.
Now, keep in mind that sampling takes time. If the drone starts an inspection at a specific minute, it must remain at that same location for the following minute to finish the task.
To prevent sensor interference, we must leave a gap. Make sure that any two inspection events are separated by at least three minutes.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- inspect_at(_, T1), inspect_at(_, T2), 0 < T1 - T2 < 3.

hard_constraints.description: Here is a specific logical pathing rule: if the drone visits NodeB and then moves to Sensor1, it is strictly forbidden from visiting NodeA at any point after that.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- at("NodeB", T1), at("Sensor1", T2), at("NodeA", T3), T1 < T2 < T3.

soft_constraints.description: Our ultimate goal is speed! We want to find the specific schedule where the very last inspection is completed as early as possible in our timeline.
soft_constraints.asp_rule:
latest_inspect(T) :- T = #max { T1 : inspect_at(_, T1) }.
#minimize { T : latest_inspect(T) }.
